title: School of Teacher Education and Liberal Arts (STELA) School Prospectus
school: School of Teacher Education and Liberal Arts (STELA)
description: STELA is envisioned as an institution for excellence in Teacher and Liberal Arts Education committed to the CICM mission of 'missio et excellentia' in forming competent, creative, socially-involved professionals imbued with Christian Spirit.
vision: To develop teachers imbued with a Christian philosophy of education, recognizing the dignity of all learners.
To foster responsibility and sensitivity for others, promoting Christian understanding and the CICM missionary perspective of the option for the poor and non-Christian.
mission: Formed from the merger of the School of Teacher Education and the School of Humanities in AY 2016–2017 under Rev. Fr. Gilbert B. Sales, CICM, to enhance student learning and community camaraderie.
goals_and_objectives: Enhance learners in their Christian philosophy of education, recognizing the dignity of individuals.
Enrich responsibility, sensitivity, and inclusivity guided by the CICM mission.
Provide knowledge and skills for creativity, critical thinking, and national development.
Innovate and sustain self-reliant, long-term growth.
Cultivate appreciation for diversity, order, beauty, science, national identity, and culture.
Instill commitment to intellectual and moral excellence.
Mold socially aware missionary disciples responsive to family, church, and societal needs.
